intro: Stoebe torta, commonly known as clustered bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Stoebe torta is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
